definition: lit. minor magician in the presence of a great one (idiom)/fig. to pale into insignificance by comparison
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: Our greenhouse is nothing compared with yours.
sentences.chinese: 我們這個溫室比起你們那個簡直是小巫見大巫。

sentences.english: That's nothing compared to what I have to suffer.
sentences.chinese: 但比起我所經受的可是小巫見大巫。

sentences.english: By comparison, the cost of American illusions pales.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，美國幻想的代價就是小巫見大巫了。

definition: scattered about like stars in the sky or chess pieces on a board (idiom); spread all over the place
lintel (of a door)/fig. family's social status
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
Dongyuan county in Heyuan 河源[He2 yuan2], Guangdong
Horizontal Alliance, clique of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
green grass like cushion (idiom); green meadow so inviting to sleep on
